text.div:
Geoposition Logical Model

The location on the surface of the Earth, described by a latitude and longitude (and optional altitude).

name: Geoposition
title: shr-core-Geoposition
description: The location on the surface of the Earth, described by a latitude and longitude (and optional altitude).

element.definition: The location on the surface of the Earth, described by a latitude and longitude (and optional altitude).

element.short: The angular distance north or south between an imaginary line around a heavenly body parallel to its equator and the equator itself. Measured with with WGS84 datum.
element.definition: The angular distance north or south between an imaginary line around a heavenly body parallel to its equator and the equator itself. Measured with with WGS84 datum.

element.short: An imaginary great circle on the surface of a heavenly body passing through the poles at right angles to the equator. Measured with with WGS84 datum.
element.definition: An imaginary great circle on the surface of a heavenly body passing through the poles at right angles to the equator. Measured with with WGS84 datum.

element.short: Height above sea level or above the earth's surface. Measured with with WGS84 datum.
element.definition: Height above sea level or above the earth's surface. Measured with with WGS84 datum.
